newsitem.title: USA: Latest Iraq crude sale brings total to $1 bln cap.
newsitem.headline: Latest Iraq crude sale brings total to $1 bln cap.

text.p: The latest crude contract approved by U.N.-appointed overseers under the oil-for-food accord puts Iraq at the monetary cap of $1 billion for the first 90-day period of the six-month deal, U.N. sources said Thursday.
U.N. overseers okayed the 34th contract for Iraq to sell Indian Oil Corp, the state-owned oil company, 3.6 million barrels of crude, or 40,000 barrels per day over a 90-day period.
The U.N. official said part of the Indian Oil Corp sale would stretch into the second 90-day tranche of the oil accord.
